result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patricia B Ballwanz

defendant.name: Ballwanz, Patricia B
defendant.address: 176 E 2nd St, Fond du Lac, WI 54935

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Patricia B Ballwanz
Current: 176 E 2nd St, Fond du Lac, WI 54935 United States  (Effective: 10-29-2015)
Prior: 112 W Water St Apt 3, Princeton, WI 54968

4:03 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 2 on 2014CT118 with no repeater, all other counts are to be dismissed and read-in.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 2 on 2014CT118 (with no repeater).  Court orders count 1 on 2014CT118 be dismissed and counts 1 & 2 on 2015CM3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

70 days county jail, with huber
$1,000 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Blood Draw Fee - $42.50
D.L. revocation - 30 months
IID - 30 months
AODA

Court immediately remands the defendant to the custody of the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Court adjourned at 4:15 p.m.

10:45 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has an offer that will be accepted.  Court will set for Plea & sentencing on March 30, 2015 at 3:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 10:46 a.m.
Status hearing on March 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on March 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.

2:11 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty BArb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond.  Court will set for Status Hearing on March 10, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:12 p.m.
